content: न {%<ab>a.</ab>%} {@--1@} Thin, spare. {@--2@} Vacant, empty. {@--3@} Same, identical. {@--4@} Unwearied. {@--5@} Praised. {@--6@} Undivided. --नः {@--1@} A pearl. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of Gaṇeśa. {@--3@} Wealth, prosperity. {@--4@} A band, tie. {@--5@} War. {@--6@} <ab>N.</ab> of Buddha. {@--7@} A gift. {%--<ab>ind.</ab>%} ({%a%}) A particle of negation equivalent to ‘not,’ ‘no,’ ‘nor,’ ‘neither’, and used in wishing, requesting, or commanding, but not in prohibition before the imperative mood. ({%b%}) Used with the potential mood न may sometimes have the force of ‘lest,’ ‘for fear lest,’ ‘that not;’ क्षत्रियैर्धार्यते शस्त्रं नार्तशब्दो भवेदिति <ls>Rām.</ls> ({%c%}) In agrumentative writings न often comes after इति चेत् and means ‘not so.’ ({%d%}) When a negative has to be repeated in successive clauses of the same sentence or in different sentences, न may be simply repeated or may be used with particles like उत, च, अपि, चापि, वा &c.; नाधीयीताश्वमारूढो न वृक्षं न च हस्तिनं . न नावं न खरं नोष्ट्रं नेरिणत्थो न यानगः .. <ls>Ms. 4. 120</ls>; प्रविशंतं न मां कश्चिदपश्यन्नाप्यवारयत् <ls>Mb.</ls>; <ls>Ms. 2. 195</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">3. 8</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 3.">9</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">4. 15</ls>; <ls>Ś. 6. 17.</ls> Sometimes न may not be expressed in the second and other clauses, but represented only by च, वा, अपिवा; संपदि यस्य न हर्षोविपदि विषादो रणे च धीरत्वं <ls>H. 1. 33.</ls> ({%e%}) न is frequently joined with a second न or any other negative particle to intensify or emphasize an assertion; प्रत्युवाच तमृषिर्न तत्त्वतस्त्वां न वेद्मि पुरुषं पुरातनं <ls>R. 11. 85</ls>; न च न परिचितो न चाप्यगम्यः <ls>M. 1. 11</ls>; न पुनरलंकारश्रियं न पुष्यति <ls>Ś. 1</ls>; नादंड्यो नाम राज्ञोऽस्ति <ls>Ms. 8. 335</ls>; <ls>Me. 63</ls>, <ls n="Me.">106</ls>; नासौ न काम्यो न च वेद सम्यग् द्रष्टुं न सा <ls>R. 6. 30</ls>; <ls>Śi. 1. 55</ls>; <ls>Ve. 2. 10.</ls> ({%f%}) In a few cases न is retained at the beginning of a negative Tatpuruṣa compound; as नाक, नासत्य, नकुल; see <ls>P. VI. 3. 75.</ls> ({%g%}) न is often joined with other particles; नच, नवा, नैव नतु, नचेद्, नखलु &c. &c. ({%h%}) It is also used, especially in early Vedic literature, in the sense of ‘like,’ ‘as,’ ‘as it were’; गावो न गव्यूतीरनु; <ls>Śi. 20. 4.</ls> {%<ab>v. l.</ab>%}
